meanings.definition: Mercenary soldiers in Italy during the Renaissance.
meanings.sent1: The condottieri were hired fighters in Italy long ago.
meanings.sent2: During the Renaissance, condottieri were common in Italian warfare.
meanings.sent3: The condottieri decided to start a Renaissance-themed book club.
meanings.sent4: The condottieri's loyalty was as fleeting as the wind.
meanings.sent5: The image of the condottieri charging into battle is etched in history.

meanings.definition: A leader or commander of mercenary soldiers.
meanings.sent1: The condottieri was a skilled leader on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: As a condottieri, he commanded respect among his soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The condottieri tried to lead a group of ducks in formation.
meanings.sent4: His presence on the battlefield was as commanding as a storm.
meanings.sent5: The condottieri's strategic mind won many battles for his army.

meanings.definition: A group of mercenary soldiers led by a condottiere.
meanings.sent1: The condottieri marched together, a formidable force.
meanings.sent2: In history, many battles were won by condottieri and their troops.
meanings.sent3: The condottieri's group decided to form a band for fun.
meanings.sent4: Their unity in battle was as strong as steel.
meanings.sent5: The condottieri and his soldiers moved as one, unstoppable in their advance.
